intro: Centaurea magocsyana, commonly known as the Magocsy's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to Hungary. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It produces vibrant blue to purple flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
